script.dialog: Remember!
Somebody always loves you.
Please don't give up.
I won't give up!
That dream again?
No.    That was not a dream.
I can remember the past few days now.
But the monsters will have forgotten about me.
I'll go check outside.
It's raining again.
This is not natural.
It has been raining for much too long.
Hello, Little Robot.
Hello young Zaraden.
This Unit has detected an unusual expression from the young Zaraden.
I don't feel so good.|L||!|I love the rain, but this is just too much.
It feels like it will never end.
And I don't do so well when the thunder starts.
Astraphobia is quite common among Zaraden.
|C3|Suggestion:|C0| Hold both of your antennae with your hands after seeing a lightning bolt.
This will dampen the perceived volume of the following thunder.
Thanks, Little Robot.
Do you know how long ago this rain started?
This Unit will now search her memory to determine the amount of days that have passed since the rain began.
|C3|Searching       .       .       .|C0|
|C3|Complete:|C0| 148 days.
|shake|A hundred and forty what!?
A hundred     and     forty-eight        days.
This Unit has determined, by your expression, that 148 consecutive days of rain is an unusually long amount of time.
I thought it would be 10 days or something.|L|148 days is just impossible!
That is so much time, and I don't remember most of it.|L||!|It's a little scary.
|C3|Update:|C0| Through the use of atmospheric readings, This Unit has calculated a 0.01% chance of rain by tomorrow morning.
So the rain will stop tomorrow?
The probability of rain occuring tomorrow is nearly zero.
That is so good to hear.|L||!|Thank you for doing that for me.
|wave|I love you, Little Robot!
This Unit is feeling immense joy.
